hed: Justin Timberlake in *Vanity Fair*: A Free Man in L.A.
dek: Since turning 30, in January, __Justin Timberlake__ has been kicking back, trying to make sense of his wild two-decade ride from the Mickey Mouse Club to music and movie stardom. For the July 2011 issue, photographed by Norman Jean Roy, Timberlake lets Vanessa Grigoriadis in on why he stripped for the camera in *Friends with Benefits*, what he and Britney Spears shared back in the ’NSync days, and how the tabloids distorted his split with Jessica Biel.

items.caption:
__HOMEBODIES__

Timberlake and Stone at the Mavis Residence. “I could see myself only doing one more big [concert] tour,” he says.
items.credit: Photograph by Norman Jean Roy; Styled by Jessica Diehl.

items.caption:
__POSTMODERN LIVING__

Timberlake and Stone in Rancho Mirage, in and around the Mavis Residence, designed in 1955 by William Cody.
items.credit: Photograph by Norman Jean Roy; Styled by Jessica Diehl.

items.caption:
__POSTMODERN LIVING__

Timberlake and Stone in Rancho Mirage, in and around the Mavis Residence, designed in 1955 by William Cody.
items.credit: Photograph by Norman Jean Roy; Styled by Jessica Diehl.

items.caption:
__FORMAL AFFAIR__

Justin Timberlake and model Lara Stone in Rancho Mirage, California. Timberlake dislikes being in the public eye even though he has been an entertainer since the age of 11.
items.credit: Photograph by Norman Jean Roy; Styled by Jessica Diehl.
Photograph by Norman Jean Roy; Styled by Jessica Diehl.

items.caption:
__PADDLES AND BALLS__ 

Playing Ping-Pong with Stone. “I figured this is the time, before gravity gets the best of me,” Timberlake says of nude scenes in a new movie.
items.credit: Photograph by Norman Jean Roy; Styled by Jessica Diehl.

items.caption:
__PADDLES AND BALLS__ 

Playing Ping-Pong with Stone. “I figured this is the time, before gravity gets the best of me,” Timberlake says of nude scenes in a new movie.
items.credit: Photograph by Norman Jean Roy; Styled by Jessica Diehl.

fields.name: Vanity Fair
fields.bio: *Vanity Fair* features in-depth reporting, gripping narratives, and world-class photography, plus heaping doses of Oscar-blogging, royal-watching, and assorted guilty pleasures.  Every month,the magazine commissions the best writers and photographers to explain the pressing issues of the day and take the pulse of the culture. Vanity Fair consistently delivers crucial reporting on business and finance, domestic politics and world affairs, even as it covers the very best in arts and entertainment.
